title: Indoor and Outdoor Air Pollution Trends in Graph

content.question: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from the data presented in the graph?

choices.label: In moderately developed regions such as China and Latin America, an individual’s health is more or as likely to be affected by urban outdoor pollution than by indoor pollution.
Developing regions such as sub-Saharan Africa are less affected by indoor air pollution because there is no source of radon in the region.
Indoor air pollutants decrease and urban outdoor pollutants increase as countries become more industrialized.
The amount of both indoor and outdoor air pollution is directly linked to the size of each region.

content.answer: In moderately developed regions such as China and Latin America, an individual’s health is more or as likely to be affected by urban outdoor pollution than by indoor pollution.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
